Articles.Content:
I'm in a new 1.1 career.  I declined 2 focused Kerbin survey contract and lost 2 points of reputation.  In the last version you could toggle a button so declining annoying contracts didn't cost rep. but I don't see that option anywhere now.  Am I missing it?

Can anyone confirm that declining contracts before accepting them costs rep, and that there is no way to toggle this off now?

It's in the settings you choose at the start when creating and naming a new game. If you chose "medium" difficulty then refusing contracts costs 2 rep. If you just used the normal difficulty (i.e. without clicking on the difficulty setting at all) it should be -1.

This was much the same in 1.0.5. I don't know if there is any way to toggle it off without messing with your save file.
You don't have to decline contracts, you can just let them expire for free too..
If you chose "custom game" when setting up career, its the bottom right option, decline penalty. Goes from 0-10 iirc.

I really don't like this change as getting the next world's first contract frequently requires declining several trivial but pointless contracts.. Its very annoying.

Glad to see there's an option I hadn't noticed. Thanks

Edited April 22, 2016 by ghpstage
